work.name: Heidelberg Institute for Theoretical Studies
work.summary: I'm a postdoc at the NLP group, working with Michael Strube.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

courses: Thesis: Developmental, Typological, and Diachronic Applications of Cognitively Plausible Language Models

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: They saw it, onu, 它, coming: An information theoretic study of cross-linguistic variation in personal pronouns
publications.summary: We explored properties of personal pronouns with surprisal in miniciep+, a multilingual parallel corpus created by Annemarie Verkerk's group.

publications.name: WinoPron: Revisiting English Winogender Schemas for Consistency, Coverage, and Grammatical Case
publications.publisher: In Proceedings of the Seventh Workshop on Computational Models of Reference, Anaphora and Coreference,

publications.name: :trophy: Large GPT-like Models are Bad Babies: A Closer Look at the Relationship between Linguistic Competence and Psycholinguistic Measures
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 5th Workshop on Research in Computational Linguistic Typology and Multilingual NLP

publications.name: Modeling Diachronic Change in English Scientific Writing over 300+ Years with Transformer-based Language Model Surprisal
publications.publisher: Proceedings of the 17th Workshop on Building and Using Comparable Corpora (BUCC) @ LREC-COLING 2024

publications.name: Information-Theoretic Characterization of Vowel Harmony: A Cross-Linguistic Study on Word Lists

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
